page.title: 10G.W.R. in Hereford.
page.content: { { }The old railway line is near our school. The modern line, which is at the end of the old line, is called the {Ross Road Junction. On Saturday,6th July, 1985 a steam train came along the modern line. I went to an exhibition to commemorate 150 years of the{Great Western {Railway.}The Mayor of Hereford was there and Councillor Evans. The King George V{steam engine arrived from Bulmers. The steam train was running from Hereford Station to Cardiff Station. The Mayor inspected the engine. Later on my friend and I had a look in the{coaches.}They were much smarter than coaches of today.
